DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-EM-CITACOES-BIBLIOGRAFICAS: RALHA, Célia Ghedini;Ralha, Célia Ghedini;Ghedini Ralha, Célia;Ralha, Célia;RALHA, C. G.;RALHA, CÉLIA G.;Célia G. Ralha;GHEDINI, Celia;C. GHEDINI;Celia Ralha;Ralha, Celia;Celia G. Ralha;Ralha, Celia G.;G. RALHA, CELIA;Ralha, Celia Ghedini;GHEDINI RALHA, CELIA

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Célia Ghedini Ralha é PhD pela Universidade de Leeds, Inglaterra (1996), mestre em Eletrônica e Engenharia da Computação pelo Instituto Tecnológico de Aeronáutica-ITA (1990), e pós-doutora pela Brandenburgische Technische Universität Cottbus, Alemanha (2012-2013). Professora associada IV do Departamento de Ciência da Computação da Universidade de Brasília (UnB, aposentada), onde atuou como coordenadora do Bacharelado em Ciência da Computação (2004-2006) e chefe do departamento durante duas gestões subsequentes (2006-2010). Colaborou com o Decanato de Pesquisa e Pós-Graduação (DPP) da UnB no cargo de Diretora de Desenvolvimento Institucional e Inovação (2010-2012). É membro efetivo do Programa de Pós-Graduação em Informática da UnB desde sua criação em 2003, tendo sido coordenadora do Programa no biênio 2015-2017, quando o programa recebeu Nota 5 na CAPES. Foi professora visitante no Programa de Pós-Graduação em Informática do Departamento de Ciência da Computação do Instituto de Ciências Exatas da UnB (2020-2022). Foi professora visitante na Australian National University (ANU), Canberra, Austrália (2024). Atualmente exerce as suas atividades na UnB como Professora Voluntária. Orienta trabalhos acadêmicos a nível de graduação (48 monografias e 30 trabalhos de iniciação científica), especialização (8 monografias), mestrado (34 dissertações), doutorado (9 teses) e um pós-doutorado. Tem experiência na área de Ciência da Computação com foco em sistemas inteligentes, particularmente utilizando modelos baseado em agentes. Segundo classificação SCOPUS suas publicações tem foco nas seguintes áreas: Ciência da Computação, Matemática, Engenharia, Ciência da Decisão, Negócios e Gestão, com tópicos de maior contribuição 2018-2022, heurísticas, lógica temporal linear, tecnologia de planejamento. É líder do grupo de pesquisa InfoKnow - Computer Systems for Information and Knowledge Treatment (credenciado no CNPq). Foi coordenadora geral da Comissão Especial de Sistemas de Informação (CESI) da Sociedade Brasileira de Computação (SBC) no período de 2013-2015, tendo atuado também como vice-coordenadora da CESI no biênio 2010-2011.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: Célia Ghedini Ralha holds a PhD from the University of Leeds, England (1996), a master's degree in Electronics and Computer Engineering from the Instituto Tecnológico de Aeronáutica-ITA (1990), and a post-doctorate from the Brandenburgische Technische Universität Cottbus, Germany (2012-2013). Associate Professor IV (retired) at the Department of Computer Science at the University of Brasília (UnB), where she served as coordinator of the Bachelor of Computer Science (2004-2006) and head of the department during two subsequent terms (2006-2010). She collaborated with the Dean of Research and Graduate Studies (DPP) at UnB as Director of Institutional Development and Innovation (2010-2012). She is a member of the Informatics Graduate Program at UnB since its creation in 2003 and coordinator in the biennium 2015-2017. She was a visiting professor at the Informatics Graduate Program at the Department of Computer Science, Institute of Exact Sciences at UnB (2020-2022). She currently works at UnB as a Volunteer Professor. He supervises academic works at the undergraduate level (46 monographs and 30 scientific initiation works), specialization (8 monographs), master's degree (31 dissertations), doctorate (6 theses), and post-doctorate. She has experience in Computer Science with a focus on intelligent systems using agent-based models. According to the SCOPUS classification, its publications focus on the following areas: Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, Decision Science, Business, and Management. He is the leader of the InfoKnow - Computer Systems for Information and Knowledge Treatment research group (accredited by the CNPq). She was the general coordinator of the Special Commission on Information Systems (CE-SI) of the Brazilian Computer Society (SBC) from 2013-2015, having also acted as vice-coordinator of the CE-SI/SBC in the biennium 2010-2011.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Este projeto de pesquisa teve início desde o doutoramento em Leeds/Inglaterra com a definição de um framework de estruturação automática de informação na Web. O framework é baseado em dois aspectos principais: linkagem dinâmica de conteúdos na Web e raciocínio espacial com uso de lógica topológica. Através de implementações de buscadores automáticos inteligentes é possível a associação semântica de assuntos na Web de acordo com tipos de relacionamento de conteúdos, tais como: igualdade, própria parte, sobreposição e desconexão.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: O objetivo deste projeto é criar uma rede de pesquisa e desenvolvimento em bioinformática integrando instituições de pesquisa e ensino do Centro-Oeste, capaz de oferecer apoio aos grupos de pesquisa genômica e proteômica (conhecimentos e ferramentas), além de formar e qualificar recursos humanos nas áreas de Biotecnologia e Bioinfomática nesta região. A primeira e segunda versões deste projeto foram ambas aprovadas pelo CNPq, em 2003 e em 2005, respectivamente. A terceira versão foi aprovada pela FINEP em 2007

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
A Computação Forense envolve a análise de sistemas, o que demanda grande quantidade de recursos e ferramentas. Visando uma maior agilidade e eficiência dos processos investigativos, o uso de um sistema multiagente distribuído revelou-se apropriado, principalmente devido a capacidade de cooperação de agentes autônomos especializados. Para tal, diferentes agentes foram implementados, cada qual baseado em uma área específica de conhecimento técnico pericial. Assim sendo, neste projeto foi definido uma arquitetura baseada em uso de sistema multiagente, composta de quatro camadas, como uma metáfora à hierarquia das organizações, a saber: estratégica, tática, operacional e especialista. Foi desenvolvido um protótipo denominado MADIK, uma ferramenta multiagente de investigação digital criada com o propósito de auxiliar
especialistas durante o exame pericial. A arquitetura proposta e a ferramenta multiagente foram construídas utilizando o conceito de blackboard e implementadas com o framework de desenvolvimento JADE. Alguns experimentos com dados reais de casos forense foram feitos utilizando o MADIK e os resultados s?ao encorajadores.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: MASE: Multi-agent System for Environmental Simulation
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Recentemente, modelos de simulação se tornaram um campo promissor de pesquisas multidisciplinares. Uma especial classe de modelos de simulação é representada pelos modelos espaciais ou de paisagem, que simulam mudanças dos atributos do meio-ambiente através do território geográfico. O uso destes modelos visa auxiliar o entendimento dos mecanismos causais e processos de desenvolvimento de sistemas ambientais, podendo determinar como eles evoluem diante de um conjunto de fatores. Esta proposta de projeto de pesquisa, apresenta a definição e o desenvolvimento de uma ferramenta de simulação com uso de técnicas inteligentes para auxílio à Gestão Ambiental. Está previsto durante a realização da pesquisa a definição de modelos de simulação como o desflorestamento da Amazônia e o bioma do Cerrado. Através do protótipo da ferramenta funcional e dos modelos de simulação definidos será possível a realização de simulações espaciais que sirvam como instrumento de suporte a decisões de ordenamento territorial, validando a proposta não somente como objeto de pesquisa acadêmica, mas como recurso real no âmbito de instituições públicas ligadas ao Distrito Federal.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: AGMI: An AGent-MIning tool to Identify Cartel Formation
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: The main focus of this research project is the problem of extracting useful information from the Brazilian federal procurement process databases used by government auditors in the process of corruption detection and prevention to identify cartel formation among applicants. Extracting useful information to enhance cartel detection is a complex problem from many perspectives due to the large volume of data used to correlate information and the dynamic and diversified strategies companies use to hide their fraudulent operations. To attack the problem of data volume, we have used two data mining model functions, clustering and association rules, and a multi-agent approach to address the dynamic strategies of companies that are involved in cartel formation. To integrate both solutions, we have developed AGMI, an agent-mining tool that was validated using real data from the Brazilian Office of the Comptroller General, an institution of government auditing, where several measures are currently used to prevent and fight corruption. Our approach resulted in explicit knowledge discovery because AGMI presented many association rules that provided a 90% correct identification of cartel formation, according to expert assessment. According to auditing specialists, the extracted knowledge could help in the detection, prevention and monitoring of cartels that act in public procurement processes.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: The main focus of this research project is the problem of extracting useful information from the Brazilian federal procurement process databases used by government auditors in the process of corruption detection and prevention to identify cartel formation among applicants. Extracting useful information to enhance cartel detection is a complex problem from many perspectives due to the large volume of data used to correlate information and the dynamic and diversified strategies companies use to hide their fraudulent operations. To attack the problem of data volume, we have used two data mining model functions, clustering and association rules, and a multi-agent approach to address the dynamic strategies of companies that are involved in cartel formation. To integrate both solutions, we have developed AGMI, an agent-mining tool that was validated using real data from the Brazilian Office of the Comptroller General, an institution of government auditing, where several measures are currently used to prevent and fight corruption. Our approach resulted in explicit knowledge discovery because AGMI presented many association rules that provided a 90% correct identification of cartel formation, according to expert assessment. According to auditing specialists, the extracted knowledge could help in the detection, prevention and monitoring of cartels that act in public procurement processes.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Identifying Cartel Formation with an AGent-MIning tool (AGMI)

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Process mining techniques are able to discover process models from event logs but there is a gap between the low-level nature of events and the high-level abstraction of business activities. In this research, we introduce an approach that is able to capture such relationship in a hierarchical Markov model through a combination of process mining and agent-based simulation. The approach supports the improvement of the process model so that it becomes a better representation for the behavior of agents in the process. For this purpose, the model is evaluated based on a set of metrics. We illustrate the approach in different application scenarios.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Recomendação Contextualizada de Eventos Baseada em Propagação da Ativação da Memória
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: As técnicas tradicionais de recomendação não consideram as preferências do usuário de acordo com o contexto. No entanto, os sistemas de recomendação que agregam elementos contextuais, geralmente, são baseados em descrição sintática ou em valores numéricos informados explicitamente pelo usuário, o que pode gerar recomendações fora do domínio desejado e limitar a transparência do sistema na interação usuário-ambiente, um dos objetivos da Computação Pervasiva. Para que o processo de recomendação seja personalizado e transparente ao usuário, é necessário uma aplicação que filtre proativamente o conteúdo de acordo com a situação corrente e preferências do usuário. Neste sentido, o objetivo deste trabalho é apresentar uma arquitetura baseada em agentes que permita a extração incremental de padrões comportamentais semanticamente relacionados e oferte informações contextualizadas aos usuários em um campus universitário, auxiliando-os e facilitando o acesso a informações acadêmicas e culturais.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Federated Cloud Computing for Bioinformatics: Infrastructure, Algorithms and Applications
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: This international collaborative project involves three research areas: High Performance Computing, Data Storage/Retrieval and Bioinformatics applications. It will integrate the efforts of the INRIA-Saclay, Mines ParisTech, Universidade de Brasília, Universidade Federal Fluminense, Embrapa-Cenargen and Universidad de Santiago de Chile in order to achieve the following goals: investigate which characteristics of Bioinformatics Applications have to be considered when choosing/proposing a Federated Cloud infrastructure; characteristics such as large-scale data management, workflow orchestration/integration and resource federation will be studied in detail. Investigate and propose new Bioinformatics tools that are adapted to the Federated Cloud environment; investigate and propose new Bioinformatics algorithms that deal with huge data sets, aiming to reduce execution time and/or the amount of memory needed, making them suitable for Federated Cloud Computing environments; investigate which performance metrics must be taken into consideration when running applications on a Federated Cloud environment; joint publications in Journals and Conferences in the areas of Computer Science and Bioinformatics. Fazem parte do projeto, as seguintes instituições: Brasil - UnB, Embrapa/CENARGEN e UFF; França - Mines ParisTech e INRIA/Paris-Sud University; Chile: Universidad de Santiago de Chile.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Federated Cloud Computing for Bioinformatics: Infrastructure, Algorithms and Applications

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: SCI-synergy is an online artifact built upon the Design-Science Research paradigm to provide intra and inter-institutional scientific collaboration network views. The Digital Bibliography & Library Project repository (DBLP) is being used as data source with a graph NoSQL database (neo4j) as storage and a python web app to present the information. SCI-Synergy was validated using data from researchers of five Computer Science graduate programs of Federal Brazilian Universities: Federal University of Minas Gerais (UFMG), University of Sao Paulo (USP), Federal University of Rio Grande do Norte (UFRN), Federal University of Amazonas (UFAM) and University of Brasilia (UnB). SCI-Synergy presents views of the collaboration networks between researchers considering researchers not linked to the cited programs, but with co-authorship relationships.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: SCI-synergy is an online artifact built upon the Design-Science Research paradigm to provide intra and inter-institutional scientific collaboration network views. The Digital Bibliography & Library Project repository (DBLP) is being used as data source with a graph NoSQL database (neo4j) as storage and a python web app to present the resulting information. SCI-Synergy was validated using data from researchers of five Computer Science graduate programs of Federal Brazilian Universities: Federal University of Minas Gerais (UFMG), University of Sao Paulo (USP), Federal University of Rio Grande do Norte (UFRN), Federal University of Amazonas (UFAM) and University of Brasilia (UnB). SCI-Synergy presents views of the collaboration networks between researchers considering researchers not linked to the cited programs, but with co-authorship relationships.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Multi-agent planning is the agents? coordination process which is a computacionally hard problem. Many works focus on the planning strategy considering the computational process, agents? distribution roles, information privacy, and the resources coupling level. But domain-independent models that explore the balance between coordination process and privacy leading to an efficient execution solution are missing. This project investigates the development of an efficient and domain-independent multi-agent planning model called LCMAP (Lightweight Coordination Multi-Agent Planning) to balance coordination process and privacy through three independent phases: verification, transformation and validation. LCMAP is compared to the state-of-the-art models to evaluate time efficiency and plan length during the problem solving process using loosely and tightly coupled domains with specific evaluation metrics inherited from planning competions. Regarding real world-problems, LCMAP is evaluated as a solution for teamwork management presenting suitability for most of the phases: potential recognition, team formation, planning and team action.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Multi-agent planning is the agents? coordination process which is a computacionally hard problem. Many works focus on the planning strategy considering the computational process, agents? distribution roles, information privacy, and the resources coupling level. But domain-independent models that explore the balance between coordination process and privacy leading to an efficient execution solution are missing. This project investigates the development of an efficient and domain-independent multi-agent planning model called LCMAP (Lightweight Coordination Multi-Agent Planning) to balance coordination process and privacy through three independent phases: verification, transformation and validation. LCMAP is compared to the state-of-the-art models to evaluate time efficiency and plan length during the problem solving process using loosely and tightly coupled domains with specific evaluation metrics inherited from planning competions. Regarding real world-problems, LCMAP is evaluated as a solution for teamwork management presenting suitability for most of the phases: potential recognition, team formation, planning and team action.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: The cloud computing model plays a central role providing on-demand processing and storage to online services. The model works very well for digital services, but for some applications low latency communication and sensitive response time are crucial. In this case the centralization of computing and storage capabilities promoted by the cloud model could lead to worse quality of service (QoS). To face some of these issues the fog computing model seeks to spread the cloud capabilities to the network edge. In this context, this project applies a trust and reputation (T&R) model based on the node selection approach to the fog computing paradigm. A multiagent system for coordinating devices that work as fog nodes and end devices is applied to consume services from the fog.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: The cloud computing model plays a central role providing on-demand processing and storage to online services. The model works very well for digital services, but for some applications low latency communication and sensitive response time are crucial. In this case the centralization of computing and storage capabilities promoted by the cloud model could lead to worse quality of service (QoS). To face some of these issues the fog computing model seeks to spread the cloud capabilities to the network edge. In this context, this project applies a trust and reputation (T&R) model based on the node selection approach to the fog computing paradigm. A multiagent system for coordinating devices that work as fog nodes and end devices is applied to consume services from the fog.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Cloud computing has been used as the primary IT solution alternative to provide scalable, reliable and pay-per-use resources and services on-demand, including trusted servers and transient servers.The implementation of fault-tolerant approaches that ensure the reliability and the services continuity becomes a major requirement for users that want to effectively explore cheaper transient servers. This project investigate and propose a multi-agent framework to provide a transparent and resilient environment on transient servers by using multiple fault-tolerant strategies called BRA2Cloud (Brand new Resilient Agent-based Architecture for Cloud computing). The proposed framework uses a reasoning process to predict failure events helping to adjust fault tolerance plans and parameters. The framework includes elements to recognize the transient server environment, being useful to identify risks to the current server?s availability, achieving better levels of reliability reducing the total cost and execution time.

This project investigate and propose a multi-agent framework to provide a transparent and resilient environment on transient servers by using multiple fault-tolerant strategies called BRA2Cloud (Brand new Resilient Agent-based Architecture for Cloud computing). PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Fog Radio Access Networks (F-RANs) apply fog computing paradigms to cloud radio access networks. Artificial Intelligence (AI) techniques are useful to F-RANs in order to achieve enhanced energy efficiency, increased throughput, and decreased processing power consumption. In any scenario, the selection of the appropriate AI technique must consider the different time granularities at which decision-making occurs. This project investigates the benefits and challenges of implementing AI-driven F-RANs considering different time granularities: hours, minutes/seconds and milliseconds. Machine Learning (ML) techniques such as deep neural networks, reinforcement learning/online based algorithms and classifiers are investigated.

In any scenario, the selection of the appropriate AI technique must consider the different time granularities at which decision-making occurs. PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Dynamic provisioning of computational resources in cloud platforms is a challenging problem. In this scenario, multiagent system technology offers improvements using intelligent agents to dynamically choose the best computational load distribution reducing execution time and cloud services cost. This project presents MAS-Cloud, a multiagent system to dynamically monitor, predict and provide computational resources in cloud platforms. Using deductive reasoning agents to cooperatively act in a three layer architecture, it is provided transparent horizontal elasticity of virtual machines in public
cloud platforms (i.e., Google, Amazon EC2). MAS-Cloud was evaluated with an agent-based simulator called MASE-BDI that is a nondeterministic and CPU intensive application providing a challenging validation case. A multiple linear regression model was
used presenting good predictions with reduced mean absolute percent error (MAPE) of 3.59% CPU usage and 5.28% of execution time in the Google platform, and similar results in the Amazon EC2 platform.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES:
Dynamic provisioning of computational resources in cloud platforms is a challenging problem. In this scenario, multiagent system technology offers improvements using intelligent agents to dynamically choose the best computational load distribution reducing execution time and cloud services cost. This project presents MAS-Cloud, a multiagent system to dynamically monitor, predict and provide computational resources in cloud platforms. Using deductive reasoning agents to cooperatively act in a three layer architecture, it is provided transparent horizontal elasticity of virtual machines in public
cloud platforms (i.e., Google, Amazon EC2). MAS-Cloud was evaluated with an agent-based simulator called MASE-BDI that is a nondeterministic and CPU intensive application providing a challenging validation case. A multiple linear regression model was
used presenting good predictions with reduced mean absolute percent error (MAPE) of 3.59% CPU usage and 5.28% of execution time in the Google platform, and similar results in the Amazon EC2 platform.

FINANCIADOR-DO-PROJETO.NOME-INSTITUICAO: Fundação de Apoio à Pesquisa do Distrito Federal

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: BioCloud ? Um Framework para Execução Eficiente de Aplicações de Biotecnologia em Múltiplas Plataformas da Nuvem AWS
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
O objetivo principal do projeto é prover melhores soluções para o problema de gerência de recursos para execução de aplicações de alto desempenho de Biotecnologia em nuvens de computadores e, em particular, na nuvem Amazon AWS. Para tanto, abordaremos os problemas de escalonamento dinâmico de máquinas virtuais (MVs) e contêineres elásticos visando a minimização do uso de recursos, do tempo de execução, economia de energia e maximizando a disponibilidade sem violar os acordos de nível de
serviço contratados. Investigaremos também estratégias paralelas e distribuídas adaptadas à execução das aplicações alvo na nuvem.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: The main objective of the project is to provide better solutions to the resource management problem for running high-performance Biotechnology applications in computer clouds, in the Amazon AWS cloud. To this end, we will address the problems of dynamic scaling of virtual machines (VMs) and elastic containers aiming at minimizing the use of resources, execution time, energy savings and maximizing availability without violating the level service agreements. We will also investigate parallel and distributed strategies adapted to the execution of target applications in the cloud.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: BioCloud ? Um Framework para Execução Eficiente de Aplicações de Biotecnologia em Múltiplas Plataformas da Nuvem AWS

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: 74ª Reunião Anual (RA) da Sociedade Brasileira para o Progresso da Ciência (SBPC)
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Projeto da Universidade de Brasília (UnB) para promoção da 74ª Reunião Anual da SBPC, a ser realizada entre os dias 24 e 30 de julho de 2022. A reunião acontecerá de forma híbrida, com atividades presenciais e virtuais, nos quatro campi da UnB (Brasília, Ceilândia, Gama e Planaltina). O tema central desta edição é Ciência, Independência e Soberania Nacional com atividades de diversas áreas do conhecimento.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: The main objective of the project is to define and develop a Web-friendly social network tool to allow integration of the academic community of University of Brasília (UnB). The project uses semantic resources, we have extended the ontology CONSCIENTIAS of CNPq, we have defined a reputation model to implement in the social network, and uses geo-referencing technique for easy finding the researches in the three different UnB Campus. This project started in 2011 and is funded by the Dean of Research and Postgraduate Studies of UnB.

The IJoFCS main goal is fostering development in Forensic Computer Science, and developing and exhibiting the widest possible range of new research in the field of Forensic Computer
Science, as well, by means of encouraging researchers from all over the world to publish their work on this venue.

ATUACAO-PROFISSIONAL.NOME-INSTITUICAO: RESI : Revista Eletrônica de Sistemas de Informação

VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES:
A RESI objetiva ampliar os conhecimentos em Sistemas de Informação mediante a publicação de trabalhos de pesquisa, análises teóricas e teórico-empíricas, resenhas de interesse cadêmico e prático, além de artigos de opinião elaborados por pesquisadores, docentes e discentes,
principalmente das áreas de Informática e de Administração preocupados com a forma como as tecnologias de computação, comunicação e informação se inserem nas organizações e na sociedade.

ATUACAO-PROFISSIONAL.NOME-INSTITUICAO: iSys: Revista Brasileira de Sistemas de Informação

VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES: A iSys: Revista Brasileira de Sistemas de Informação, ISSN 1984-2902, está como estrato QUALIS B3 na área de Ciência da Computação na Capes.

VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES: A RESI: Revista Eletrônica de Sistemas de Informação, ISSN 1677-3071, está como estrato B5 do Qualis na área de Ciência da Computação em 2015.
O jornal Environmental Modelling & Software, ISSN 1364-8152, é estrato QUALIS A1 na área de Ciência da Computação na Capes com JCR 4.207 (2016).
O Journal of Web Engineering, ISSN 1540-9589, está em 2015 como estrato Qualis B1 na área de Ciência da Computação na Capes e JCR 0.622 (2016).

ATUACAO-PROFISSIONAL.NOME-INSTITUICAO: iSys: Revista Brasileira de Sistemas de Informação

VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES: A iSys-Revista Brasileira de Sistemas de Informação é uma revista acadêmica, voltada para publicações científicas na área de Sistemas de Informação. A revista é distribuída em formato eletrônico (http://www.seer.unirio.br/index.php/isys/index) através do Sistema Eletrônico de Editoração de Revistas (SEER) e desde maio 2014 é mantida pela Comissão Especial em Sistemas de Informação (CESI), da Sociedade Brasileira de Computação (SBC). Na sexta edição da iSys, referente ao ano de 2013, são apresentados 5 artigos que são versões estendidas dos melhores artigos do VIII Simpósio Brasileiro de Sistemas de Informação (SBSI 2012), o qual estive na Coordenação do Comitê de Programa.
A Data & Knowledge Engineering, ISSN 0169-023X, está classificado como periódico no estrato A2 Qualis da área de Ciência da Computação na Capes, com JCR 1.5 (2016).

The Socio-Environmental Systems Modelling (SESMO) international journal has the aim to progress our understanding, learning and decision making on major socio-environmental issues using advances in model-grounded processes that engage with institutional and governance contexts, cross-sectoral and scale challenges, and stakeholder perspectives. SESMO is an open access journal licensed under the terms of the Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 4.0 International (CC BY-NC 4.0). 
SESMO is an international community driven open access journal (ISSN 2663-3027) published by the International Environmental Modelling and Software Society, and supported by MSSANZ, TIAS, DMDU, IFIP WG 5.11, SESYNC and the WUR Library. More information available on https://sesmo.org/about

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-ORGAO: Centro de Ciências Exatas e da Natureza

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Instituto Nacional de Ciência e Tecnologia em Inteligência Artificial
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Criação do Instituto Nacional de Ciência e Tecnologia em Inteligência Artificial (INCT), o qual foi denominado IAIA. O projeto tem como objetivo reunir e estimular pesquisas científicas, tecnológicas e de inovação colaborativas em Inteligência Artificial (IA), se tornando referência de IA brasileira, internacionalmente reconhecida pela qualidade de pesquisa. A iniciativa desenvolverá um forte programa de capacitação de formação de recursos humanos em IA, inclusive IA aplicada. O IAIA tem 87 pesquisadores vinculados a 23 universidades do país. O financiamento foi feito através do Edital Nº 58/2022 - Programa Institutos Nacionais de Ciência e Tecnologia - INCT do CNPq.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This paper addresses some particular issues related to the difficult task of automatic mapping of Web Information to help user to find interesting and unexpedted information on the Web. The approach puts together qualitative and quantitative reasoning.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: E-Service Searching on the Web

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: Encontro Nacional de Inteligência Artificial

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: There are many limitations at the state of the art of electronic service that requires original research results and practical development experiences among researchers and application developers from different e-service intelligent related areas. Concerning e-service searching on the Web, the only based on attribute match is not sufficent enough to deal with partial matches and semantic conflicts. This paper proposes the use of a framework to automatic connect information on the Web, that involves qualitative spatial reasoning.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: HyperMap: A System to Map the Web

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: International Conference on Next Generation Web Services Practices (NWeSP'05)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
This paper presents HyperMap system to dynamically structure information on the Web. The system is
based on a framework resultant from a multi-disciplinary research which is briefly discussed. This paper
focuses work done to develop new generation of computational tools to support the extraction and the
discovery of useful information on the Web becoming agents of innovation and development.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Aprendizagem de Língua Assistida por Computador: Uma Abrodagem Baseada em HPSG

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: Simpósio Brasileiro de Informática na Educação

PALAVRAS-CHAVE.PALAVRA-CHAVE-2: Aprendizagem de Língua assisitda por computador

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Este trabalho analisa fundamentos e métodos pertinentes para o planejamento e desenvolvimento de sistemas de Processamento de Linguagem Natural (PLN) com o objetivo de auxiliar a aprendizagem de línguas. O foco principal é a correção sintática baseada no formalismo HPSG conforme implementado no sistema LKB (Linguistic Knowledge Building). Foi implementado um analisador em linguagem Java que, juntamente com uma gramática da língua espanhola de médio porte, permite experimentar a técnica de correção através de regras de malformação. A partir dos resultados obtidos discute-se alguns aspectos práticos e a viabilidade do PLN aplicado à educação.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Modelagem de Processos Aplicada na Gestão de um Ambiente Real de TI

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: II Simpósio Brasiliero de Sistema de Informação

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Política Econômica e Administração Pública em Geral

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Este artigo apresenta um estudo e uma aplicação prática de modelos internacionais de Tecnologia da Informação em um ambiente de tecnologia de uma das maiores instituições bancárias do país. Como instrumento de integração entre os modelos estudados e o ambiente real de TI, foi utilizada a abordagem de modelagem de processos, a qual auxilia de forma abrangente gerência da informação além de possibilitar a formalização do conhecimento.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: A Multiagent System to Help Manual Annotation on Genome Sequencing Projects

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: International Workshop on Genomic Databases (IWGD)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This article presents an architecture based on multiagent aproach to help biologists during the annotation phase on genome sequencing projects. The architecture uses ontology and data mining resources.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: A Four-layered Semantic Grid Architecture

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 19th International Conference on Software Engineering and Knowledge Engineering (SEKE 2007)

AUTORES.NOME-COMPLETO-DO-AUTOR: Alba Cristina Magalhães Alves de Melo
AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: MELO, Alba Cristina Magalhães Alves de

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Outras Atividades de Prestação de Serviços em Informática

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
In this paper, we present the design and implementation
of a Semantic Grid architecture composed by a knowledge
layer to semantically enhance the grid resource discovery
service. The knowledge layer has a semantic repository,
which enables semantic discovery of different types of computing
resources in grid environment. This layer is formed
by an ontology and a reasoner component to interact with
the semantic repository. Our prototype uses existing technologies,
like the Globus Toolkit?s MDS with Ganglia, to
illustrate our four-layered decoupled Semantic Grid architecture.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: MDA-based Ontology Development: A Study Case

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 19th International Conference on Software Engineering and Knowledge Engineering (SEKE 2007)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
In this paper, we present an experience to enable the
integration of computational systems using the eXtensible
Stylesheet Language Transformation (XSLT)-based approach
for automatic generation of the Web Ontology Language
(OWL) from a UML model developed at the medical
domain. We discuss similar approaches to automatic
transformation between a metamodel for OWL based on
the Meta-Object Facility (MOF) and an associated UML
profile. Although MDA-based techniques are promising for
ontology development, there has not been practical study
cases to demonstrate how this technology can be used in
real scenarios. In our efforts to support the model-driven
development of OWL ontologies from its Ontology UML
Profile (OUP), we illustrate the axiomatic verification of the
OUP-developed ontology extension with the use of Racer
reasoner and Prot´eg´e.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: An Improvement Proposal for Quality Guarantee Process of PSPO-ECT

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 4th International Conference on Information Systems and Technology Management (CONTECSI)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The PSPO-ECT is a standard adopted by ECT to develop and maintain software. Among its processes, there is one process that focus the guarantee of quality including planning and execution. This work proposes improvements to a complete guarantee quality cycle to be integrated to PSPO-ECT. The proposal includes the use of quality management from PMBoK/PMI and Six Sigma models of quality to the PSPO-ECT process. In addition, some templates to help the application of the proposed standard were defined and presented in this work

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: BioAgents: Um Sistema Multiagente para Anotação Manual em Projetos de Seqüênciamento de Genomas

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: VI Encontro Nacional de Inteligência Artificial - ENIA
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Anais do VI Brazilian Meeting on Artificial Intelligence (ENIA 2007)

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Produtos e Processos Biotecnológicos Vinculados À Saúde Humana Ou dos Animais

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Genome sequencing projects identify biological sequences of organisms
and their functions. The discovery of biological functions constitutes the
annotation phase, that is divided into automatic and manual. Automatic annotation
has the objective of inferring functions to the project sequences, using
databases containing biological sequences and previously determined functions.
Manual annotation is done by biologists, that decide the functions using
their biological knowledge. This work presents BioAgents, a system that uses the
Multiagent paradigm to support manual annotation. BioAgents provides interaction
of different agents using the automatic annotation outputs, and suggests
manual annotations that must be validated by biologists.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Sistemas de Informação para o Monitoramento de Intervenções Governamentais no Campo Habitacional: Desenvolvimento de um Protótipo Baseado em uma Ontologia

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: III Encontro de Tecnologia de Informação e Comunicação na Construção Civil (TIC 2007)
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Anais do III Encontro de Tecnologia de Informação e Comunicação na Construção Civil (TIC 2007)
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DA-EDITORA: UFRGS/NORIE/Grupo de Gerenciamento e Economia da Construção

AUTORES.NOME-COMPLETO-DO-AUTOR: Maria de Fatima Souza e Silva
AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: SILVA, Maria de Fatima Souza e

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Os problemas associados às habitações produzidas pelo estado para a população de baixa renda continuam sendo os mesmos que ocorriam quando da ação do Banco Nacional da Habitação, apesar de toda a evolução tecnológica que ocorreu desde então. O enfrentamento de tais problemas pelos agentes neles envolvidos pode ser apoiado em bancos de dados que contenham informações sistematizadas sobre cada programa a partir de seus projetos uma vez que facilita análises comparativas entre os programas. Neste artigo é apresentado o protótipo de um sistema cuja finalidade é apoiar a tomada de decisão sobre políticas públicas habitacionais. O protótipo foi desenvolvido para plataforma Web, com uso de banco de dados MySQL e da linguagem PHP. A base do sistema é uma ontologia que contém os significados de categorias de informação e de indicadores que venham a elas ser associados. O protótipo desenvolvido não contempla todas as temáticas de um sistema de avaliação de políticas públicas abrangente e ainda carece de validação, mas os resultados obtidos, já apontam para a viabilidade do sistema.

PALAVRAS-CHAVE.PALAVRA-CHAVE-2: Tecnologia da Informação e das Comunicações (TIC)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
O objetivo principal deste minicurso é introduzir conceitos e uma prática 
preliminar de modelagem de processos de negócio para alunos e profissionais 
ligados a área de computação. Um processo de negócio é um fluxo contínuo de 
atividades relacionadas a um objetivo da organização e que agrega valor aos 
seus produtos. O conhecimento e formas de representação dos processos através 
da atividade de modelagem são fundamentais para responder à crescente demanda 
por produtos e serviços de qualidade, estabelecendo o nível desejado de 
competitividade no mercado. Este minicurso pretende apresentar uma introdução 
sobre a teoria e o desenvolvimento metodológico na prática de modelagem de processos, como técnica importante para melhorar a aderência entre os modelos de negócio desenvolvidos nas organizações e os processos de desenvolvimento de software, orientados ao tratamento da informação e do conhecimento.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
The main objective of this course is to introduce students and professionals of the computer 
area to the theory and practice of business process modeling. A business 
process is a continuous flow of activities, which are related to an 
organization objective and which agregate value to it's products. The 
knowledge and forms to represent processes through the modeling activity 
is vital to respond to the growing necessity for quality products and services, 
establishing the desired level of the market competitiveness. This short course 
intends to present a conceptual introduction and a methodological practical 
development of process modeling, as an important technique to improve adherence 
between the organizational business models and software development processes, 
oriented to the information and knowledge treatment.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Reinforcement Learning Method for BioAgents
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Reinforcement Learning Method for BioAgents

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 11th Brazilian Symposium on Artificial Neural Network-SBRN

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Machine Learning (ML) techniques are being employed
in bioinformatics with increasing success. However, some
problems are still prohibitive for symbolic machine learning
methods. These problems are of two natures: huge amount of
data and lack of examples for training purposes. Thus, this
paper introduces the use of a further ML technique, namely
reinforcement learning (RL), with the objective of dealing with
these two drawbacks. Our work proposes and implement a
RL method to the BioAgents system, in order to make the
annotation of biological sequences in genome sequencing projects.
Experiments were done with real data from two different genome
sequencing projects: Paracoccidioides brasiliensis - Pb fungus and
Paullinia cupana - Guaran´a plant. To assign reinforcement signals
we have used reference genomes with curated annotations that
are considered correct; these signals tackle specific databases and
alignment algorithms. The results obtained with the inclusion of
a RL layer in BioAgents were better compared with the system
without the proposed method. Also, to the best of our knowledge,
this is the first attempt to apply RL techniques to annotation in
bioinformatics projects.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DA-EDITORA: IEEE Computer Society Press, IEEE Catalog Number: CFP1066C-CDR

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
Location is one of the most relevant contextual variables in the design of context-aware computing systems. These systems need to know the user's physical location in order to provide relevant information according to it. This paper presents a prototype for indoor localization based on MultiAgent System approach. Moreover, a simulation to locate
a moving user agent is carried out in this work, in order to validate the developed prototype.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Sumarização Automática de Textos para Suporte a Aplicações Sensíveis ao Tempo de Resposta

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: Conferência Ibero-Americana IADIS WWW/Internet (CIAWI)
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the Ibero-Americana IADIS WWW/Internet 2010
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DA-EDITORA: International Association for Development of the Information Society

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: O acesso à Internet por meio de dispositivos móveis introduziu novas facilidades e necessidades em termos de aplicações e serviços. Estas facilidades deram origem a computação ubíqua, permitindo o acesso à informação independente da localização geográfica. Por outro lado, a visualização de longas áreas de texto em dispositivos móveis ainda é uma barreira a ser vencida. Uma maneira de tratar esta limitação é através da sumarização automática dos textos. Apesar da sua importância, as técnicas de geração automática de textos são, em geral, proprietárias e adaptadas para cenários específicos. A principal contribuição deste trabalho é propor um sumarizador automático de textos para a língua portuguesa que atenda as necessidades de aplicações com restrição de tempo de resposta. As análises realizadas mostram que o sumarizador proposto neste trabalho possui um desempenho superior aos demais, tanto em termos de qualidade dos resultados como em tempo de resposta.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: A Multi-Agent Tool to Annotate Biological Sequences
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: A MULTI-AGENT TOOL TO ANNOTATE BIOLOGICAL SEQUENCES

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 3rd International Conference on Agents and Artificial Intelligence (ICAART)
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the ICAART 2011, Volume 2 - Agents

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Nowadays, great challenges are imposed by the existence of enormous volume of DNA and RNA sequences, which are continuously being discovered by genome sequencing projects, through the automatic sequencers based on massively parallel sequencing technologies. Thus, the task of identifying biological function for these sequences is a key activity in these high-throuput sequencing projects, where the automatic annotation must be significantly improved. In this context, this paper presents a multi-agent approach to address the
important issue of automatic annotation in genome projects. We developed a sophisticated prototype named BioAgents, which simulates biologists knowledge and experience to annotate DNA or RNA sequences in genome sequencing projects, where different specialized intelligent agents work together to accomplish the annotation process.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
Nowadays, great challenges are imposed by the existence of enormous volume of DNA and RNA sequences, which are continuously being discovered by genome sequencing projects, through the automatic sequencers based on massively parallel sequencing technologies. Thus, the task of identifying biological function for these sequences is a key activity in these high-throuput sequencing projects, where the automatic annotation must be significantly improved. In this context, this paper presents a multi-agent approach to address the
important issue of automatic annotation in genome projects. We developed a sophisticated prototype named BioAgents, which simulates biologists knowledge and experience to annotate DNA or RNA sequences in genome sequencing projects, where different specialized intelligent agents work together to accomplish the annotation process.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: AGMI - An Agent-Mining Tool and its Application to Brazilian Government Auditing
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: AGMI - An Agent-Mining Tool and its Application to Brazilian Government Auditing

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 7th International Conference on Web Information Systems and Technologies (WEBIST)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
This paper presents research combining two originally separated areas increasingly interrelated: distributed multi-agent systems and data mining. In our approach, we prove the interaction features in a bilateral and complementary way, since we have defined an integrated architecture and developed a prototype, which has been used in a government auditing study case. In Brazil, government auditing is performed by the Office
of the Comptroller General (CGU), where several approaches are being used to prevent and fight corruption. However, some activities such as government purchasing fraud detection are limited by the difficulty in finding effective ways to implement. Considering data mining perspective, we have used different model functions, such as clusterization and link analysis with association rules. Our approach integrating multi-agent and data
mining techniques resulted in expressive discovered knowledge, which would help detection of cartels acting in public bidding processes at CGU.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
This paper presents research combining two originally separated areas increasingly interrelated: distributed multi-agent systems and data mining. DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Case-Based Reasoning in Live Forensics
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: A Case-Based Reasoning Framework for Live Forensics

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 7th Annual IFIP WG 11.9 International Conference on Digital Forensics
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: IFIP Advances in Information and Communication Technology

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Administração pública, defesa e seguridade social

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Due to the large number of variables involved in a live forensic analysis, such as
the presence of encryption software or the large volume of data to be processed, the
traditional approach employed by law enforcement in search and seizure operations
involving digital evidence cannot always be employed. This paper proposes a framework
built upon case-based reasoning methodology to support this kind of analysis by reusing
knowledge from previous cases to assist the computer forensics expert to recognize risks and adopt the best procedures to ensure the optimal collection of evidence. A prototype was
implemented and tested against a set of simulated scenarios like the ones founds by the
experts. The results obtained show that this approach provides valuable assistance to the first responder on the scene, with positive impacts on the time taken to perform the work and on its chances of success. The continuous use of this system allows the construction of a knowledge base consisting of proven practices and successful cases.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: A User Location Case Study Using Different Wireless Protocols
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: An User Location Case Study Using Different Wireless Protocols

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: The 9th ACM International Workshop on Mobility Management and Wireless Access (MobiWac)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
User location is a valuable contextual information in contextaware
computing systems. These systems need to know the
user's current physical location in order to provide relevant
services. The location of mobile users can be inferred by
measuring the received signal strength. This article presents
a specic module of an agent-based framework - the Location
Agent Module - which was developed for context-aware
applications using the existing wireless network infrastructure:
WiFi, Bluetooth and ZigBee. Furthermore, we present
a comparison study with a quality of service (QoS) submodule.
The experimental results indicate that the ANN
accuracy was 72%, 63% and 67% using WiFi, Bluetooth
and ZigBee protocols, respectively. Considering the use of
QoS sub-module, we had an increase from 11% to 21% in the
results with the three protocols, increasing the accuracy to
89% to WiFi, 74% to Bluetooth and 88% to ZigBee. Based
on the promising results achieved, we consider our approach
adequate for indoor localization.

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-SUB-AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO: modelagem e simulação baseada em agentes

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In Computer science, agent-based modeling (ABM) and multi-agent simulation contribute to scenario anal-ysis, since they may represent patterns of human interaction, which are essential to a better understanding of real systems, including many different aspects such as social, economical and environmental. This paper presents the use of agent-based techniques to define and develop the MASE - Multi-Agent System for Envi-ronmental simulation model using two different design approaches: the TROPOS Agent Oriented Software Engineering methodology with JADE framework, and the Agent-Object-Relationship modeling and simulation platform. MASE model system was defined to characterize land-use change dynamics through a replicable pa-rameterization process, useful to the development of agent-based simulation frameworks. However, different agent-based design experiences can enrich the modeling and development process of environmental simulation frameworks, since they embed conceptual structure definition according to specific design concepts. Thus, in this paper we include a short discussion of challenges, perspectives and limitations of two design experiences involving different concepts and techniques for information systems analysis. We believe the reported discus-sion can serve as a starting point to define evaluation criteria for comparative analysis of different agent-based design approaches. To illustrate land-use simulations with MASE we used the Brazilian Cerrado case study.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: In Computer science, agent-based modeling (ABM) and multi-agent simulation contribute to scenario anal-ysis, since they may represent patterns of human interaction, which are essential to a better understanding of real systems, including many different aspects such as social, economical and environmental. This paper presents the use of agent-based techniques to define and develop the MASE - Multi-Agent System for Envi-ronmental simulation model using two different design approaches: the TROPOS Agent Oriented Software Engineering methodology with JADE framework, and the Agent-Object-Relationship modeling and simulation platform. MASE model system was defined to characterize land-use change dynamics through a replicable pa-rameterization process, useful to the development of agent-based simulation frameworks. However, different agent-based design experiences can enrich the modeling and development process of environmental simulation frameworks, since they embed conceptual structure definition according to specific design concepts. Thus, in this paper we include a short discussion of challenges, perspectives and limitations of two design experiences involving different concepts and techniques for information systems analysis. We believe the reported discus-sion can serve as a starting point to define evaluation criteria for comparative analysis of different agent-based design approaches. To illustrate land-use simulations with MASE we used the Brazilian Cerrado case study.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 3th International Workshop on Decision Mining & Modeling for Business Processes (DeMiMoP?15) in conjunction with Business Process Managent Conference (BPM'15)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The need for constant adaptation to address emerging demands or undesired events within organizations has grown. Unplanned situations may occur at any time during process execution and the design of a process model that predicts all paths should give place to flexible "organic" design. This paper addresses the problem of how to provide mechanisms for dynamic adaptation in Process-Aware Information Systems. On top of a theory for context-aware information systems, we propose a context management framework that aims to automate dynamic process adaptation by re-planning a process instance. The proposal was partially implemented and evaluated in a real case scenario

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: NOMS 20232023 IEEE/IFIP Network Operations and Management Symposium
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: NOMS 2023-2023 IEEE/IFIP Network Operations and Management Symposium

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Current multiple access technologies, Orthogonal Multiple Access (OMA) and Non-Orthogonal Multiple Access (NOMA) alone cannot satisfy 6G requirements and provide the connectivity to future networks. Hence, in this work, we propose an Adaptive NOMA-OMA (A-NOMA) that can benefit from interchanging multiple access technologies enhancing the Spectral Efficiency (SE). To turn feasible the interchange of transmission techniques, we model a spectrum sharing problem to exploiting the OMA-NOMA trade-off. We propose an architecture to the total spectral efficiency. Simulations resulted on an enhanced SE and provided more than 20% compared to NOMA SE and over 50% with OMA SE.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Mining the low-level behaviour of agents in high-level business processes
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Mining the low-level behaviour of agents in high-level business processes

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: International Journal of Business Process Integration and Management (Print)

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Administração pública, defesa e seguridade social

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Currently there is a gap between the high level of abstraction at which business processes are modelled and the low level nature of the events that are recorded during process execution. When applying process mining techniques, it is possible to discover the logic behind low-level events but it is difficult to determine the relationship between those low-level events and the high-level activities in a given process model. In this work, we introduce a hierarchical Markov model to capture both the high-level behaviour of activities and the low-level behaviour of events. We also develop an expectation-maximisation technique to discover that kind of hierarchical model from a given event log and a high-level description of the business process. We use this technique to understand the behaviour of agents in business processes, from the control-flow perspective and from the organisational perspective as well. Using an agent-based simulation platform (AOR), we implemented a purchasing process and generated an event log in order to illustrate the benefits of the proposed approach and to compare the results with existing process mining techniques, namely the ones that are available in the ProM framework.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: A multi-agent model system for land-use change simulation
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: A multi-agent model system for land-use change simulation

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This paper presents a multi-agent model system to characterize land-use change dynamics. The replicable parameterization process should be useful to the development of simulation frameworks, important to environmental policy makers to analyze different scenarios during decision making process. The methodological two-fold approach intends to form a solid backbone based on: (i) the systematic and structured empirical characterization of the model; and (ii) the conceptual structure definition according to the agent-based model documentation protocol ? Overview, Design concepts and Details. A multi-agent system for land-use change simulation was developed to validate the model, which is illustrated with a case study of the Brazilian Cerrado using LANDSAT ETM images. The simulation results prove the model importance with a figure of merit greater than 50%, what means the amount of correctly predicted change is larger than the sum of any type of error. The results are very good compared with nine popular peer-reviewed land change models.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: This paper presents a multi-agent model system to characterize land-use change dynamics. The replicable parameterization process should be useful to the development of simulation frameworks, important to environmental policy makers to analyze different scenarios during decision making process. The methodological two-fold approach intends to form a solid backbone based on: (i) the systematic and structured empirical characterization of the model; and (ii) the conceptual structure definition according to the agent-based model documentation protocol ? Overview, Design concepts and Details. A multi-agent system for land-use change simulation was developed to validate the model, which is illustrated with a case study of the Brazilian Cerrado using LANDSAT ETM images. The simulation results prove the model importance with a figure of merit greater than 50%, what means the amount of correctly predicted change is larger than the sum of any type of error. The results are very good compared with nine popular peer-reviewed land change models.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Agent-based Architecture for Context-aware and Personalized Event Recommendation
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Agent-based Architecture for Context-aware and Personalized Event Recommendation

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In order to offer context-aware and personalized information, intelligent processing techniques are necessary. Different initiatives considering many contexts have been proposed, but users preferences need to be learned to offer contextualized and personalized services, products or information. Therefore, this paper proposes an agent-based architecture for context-aware and personalized event recommendation based on ontology and the spreading activation algorithm. The use of ontology allows to define the domain knowledge model, while the spreading algorithm learns user patterns by discovering user interests. The proposed agent-based architecture was validated with the modeling and implementation of eAgora? application, which was illustrated at the Pervasive University context.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: In order to offer context-aware and personalized information, intelligent processing techniques are necessary. Different initiatives considering many contexts have been proposed, but users preferences need to be learned to offer contextualized and personalized services, products or information. Therefore, this paper proposes an agent-based architecture for context-aware and personalized event recommendation based on ontology and the spreading activation algorithm. The use of ontology allows to define the domain knowledge model, while the spreading algorithm learns user patterns by discovering user interests. The proposed agent-based architecture was validated with the modeling and implementation of eAgora? application, which was illustrated at the Pervasive University context.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: ObserveUnB: Observatório da Rede de Colaboração Científica da Universidade de Brasília
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: ObserveUnB: Observatory of the Scientific Collaboration Network of the University of Brasilia

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Este artigo apresenta a definição e o desenvolvimento do ObserveUnB, um observatório da rede de colaboração científica e acadêmica na Universidade de Brasília (UnB). O foco do ObserveUnB é representar e auxiliar na ampliação de rede de colaboração científica através da descoberta de potenciais parcerias. O ObserveUnB utiliza informações existentes nos Currículos Lattes dos pesquisadores da UnB, os grupos de pesquisa certificados pela instituição no Diretório de Grupos de Pesquisa do CNPq e bases de dados dos sistemas acadêmicos e de pessoal. O projeto do ObserveUnB contempla ainda a extensão da ontologia Conscientias (base do Lattes) e a definição de um modelo de reputação dos participantes da rede.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: This article presents the definition and implementation of the ObserveUnB, an observatory of the scientific and academic collaboration network in the University of Brasilia (UnB). ObserveUnB focus the representation of the network and aims to assist the expansion of the scientific collaboration net thought the partnership discovery. The ObserveUnB uses UnB researchers Lattes curriculum information, the research groups certified by UnB existing in the Directory of Research Groups of the CNPq and institutional databases. The ObserveUnB project also includes an extension of the Conscientias ontology (Lattes base) and the definition of the researcher network reputation model.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Location Agent: A Study Using Different Wireless Protocols for Indoor Localization
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Location Agent: A Study Using Different Wireless Protocols for Indoor Localization

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: International Journal of Wireless Communications and Mobile Computing

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Context-aware systems have received greater interest in the computing community. In order to provide relevant services at context-aware applications, the first task is to locate the user, what can be done preferably dynamically and intelligently. However, indoor mobile users localization is not a trivial problem, since it involves checking various devices, transmitting signals simultaneously on the same radio frequency, with possibly the three existing wireless network protocols: Wi-Fi, Bluetooth and ZigBee. In this direction, this paper presents an agent-based architecture with the Location Agent module defined for context-aware applications that uses three artificial neural network algorithms trained for the different protocols: backpropagation, backpropagation with momentum and levenberg?marquardt. Considering the research experimental aspects, a study is presented to compare the neural network algorithms including performance, regression analysis, precision and accuracy. The results indicate that the backpropagation algorithm trained with Bluetooth provides better accuracy (the average error of 0.42 meters) and the backpropagation trained with Wi-Fi provides better precision (73%). We consider our approach promising since the Location Agent has a quality of service component associated with the neural network algorithms that can choose the best received signal strength to locate indoor users.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Context-aware systems have received greater interest in the computing community. In order to provide relevant services at context-aware applications, the first task is to locate the user, what can be done preferably dynamically and intelligently. However, indoor mobile users localization is not a trivial problem, since it involves checking various devices, transmitting signals simultaneously on the same radio frequency, with possibly the three existing wireless network protocols: Wi-Fi, Bluetooth and ZigBee. In this direction, this paper presents an agent-based architecture with the Location Agent module defined for context-aware applications that uses three artificial neural network algorithms trained for the different protocols: backpropagation, backpropagation with momentum and levenberg?marquardt. Considering the research experimental aspects, a study is presented to compare the neural network algorithms including performance, regression analysis, precision and accuracy. The results indicate that the backpropagation algorithm trained with Bluetooth provides better accuracy (the average error of 0.42 meters) and the backpropagation trained with Wi-Fi provides better precision (73%). We consider our approach promising since the Location Agent has a quality of service component associated with the neural network algorithms that can choose the best received signal strength to locate indoor users.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: AUTONOMOUS AGENTS AND MULTI-AGENT SYSTEMS (DORDRECHT. ONLINE)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Computational trust and reputation models are key elements in the design of open multi-agent systems. They oer means of evaluating and reducing risks of cooperation in the presence of uncertainty. However, the models proposed in the literature do not consider the costs they introduce and how they are affected by environmental aspects. In this paper, a cognitive meta-model for adaptive trust and reputation in open multi-agent systems is presented. It acts as a complement to a non-adaptive model by allowing the agent to reason about it and react to changes in the environment. We demonstrate how the meta-model can be applied to existent models proposed in the literature, by adjusting the model's parameters. Finally, we propose evaluation criteria to drive meta-level reasoning considering the costs involved when employing trust and reputation models in dynamic environments.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Computational trust and reputation models are key elements in the design of open multi-agent systems. They oer means of evaluating and reducing risks of cooperation in the presence of uncertainty. However, the models proposed in the literature do not consider the costs they introduce and how they are affected by environmental aspects. In this paper, a cognitive meta-model for adaptive trust and reputation in open multi-agent systems is presented. It acts as a complement to a non-adaptive model by allowing the agent to reason about it and react to changes in the environment. We demonstrate how the meta-model can be applied to existent models proposed in the literature, by adjusting the model's parameters. Finally, we propose evaluation criteria to drive meta-level reasoning considering the costs involved when employing trust and reputation models in dynamic environments.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Knowledge-based reasoning to annotate noncoding RNA using multi-agent system
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Knowledge-based reasoning to annotate noncoding RNA using multi-agent system

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: Journal of Bioinformatics and Computational Biology

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Noncoding RNAs (ncRNAs) have been focus of intense research over the last few years. Since characteristics and signals of ncRNAs are not entirely known, researchers use different computational tools together with their biological knowledge to predict putative ncRNAs. In this context, this work presents ncRNA-Agents, a multi-agent system to annotate ncRNAs based on the output of different tools, using inference rules to simulate biologists' reasoning. Experiments with data from the fungus Saccharomyces cerevisiae allowed to measure the performance of ncRNA-Agents, with better sensibility, when compared to Infernal, a widely used tool for annotating ncRNA. Besides, data of the Schizosaccharomyces pombe and Paracoccidioides brasiliensis fungi identified novel putative ncRNAs, which demonstrated the usefulness of our approach. NcRNA-Agents can be be found at: http://www.biomol.unb.br/ncrna-agents.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Power-aware server consolidation for federated clouds
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Power-aware server consolidation for federated clouds

AUTORES.NOME-COMPLETO-DO-AUTOR: Alba Cristina Magalhães Alves de Melo

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Cloud computing has evolved to provide computing resources on-demand through a virtualized infrastructure, letting applications, computing power, data storage, and network resources to be provisioned and managed over private networks or over the Internet. Cloud services normally run on large data centers and demand a huge amount of electricity. Consequently, the electricity cost represents one of the major concerns of data centers, because it is sometimes nonlinear with the capacity of the data centers, and it is also associated with a high amount of carbon emission (CO2). However, energy-saving schemes that result in too much degradation of the system performance or in violations of service-level agreement (SLA) parameters would eventually cause the users to move to another cloud provider. Thus, there is a need to reach a balance between energy savings and the costs incurred by these savings in the execution of the applications. Therefore, in this paper, we propose and evaluate a power and SLA-aware application consolidation solution for cloud federations. It comprises a multi-agent system for server consolidation, taking into account SLA, power consumption, and carbon footprint. Different for similar solutions available in the literature, in our solution, when a cloud is overloaded, its data center needs to negotiate with other data centers before migrating the workload to another cloud. Simulation results show that our approach can reduce up to 46% of the power consumption while trying to meet performance requirements. Furthermore, we show that federated clouds can provide an adequate solution to deal with power consumption in the clouds.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: An empirical workflow to integrate uncertainty and sensitivity analysis to evaluate agent-based simulation outputs
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: An empirical workflow to integrate uncertainty and sensitivity analysis to evaluate agent-based simulation outputs

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: This paper presents an empirical study comparing different uncertainty analysis (UA) and sensitivity analysis (SA) methods, focussing their usefulness for the output analysis of land use/land cover change (LUCC) agent-based models (ABMs). As a result, a workflow to integrate UA and SA is presented to evaluate ABMs outputs. We developed a baseline scenario and performed a comprehensive investigation of the impacts that differences in sample sizes, sample techniques, and SA methods may have on the model output. The analysis is done in the context of a particular agent-based simulator with a LUCC model in a Brazilian Cerrado case study. The experiments indicate that there are known challenges to be overcome by the use of statistical methods. Even though the presented analysis was done over a particular simulator, we intend to contribute to the community that understands the importance of statistical validation techniques to improve the level of confidence in agent-based simulation outputs.
